questions.question: We have ............................ to hear from him.
questions.description: Yet suggests that something which is expected has not happened.

questions.question: I have .............................. sent the application.
questions.description: Already suggests that something has happened sooner than expected.

questions.question: They have ............................... to make a formal announcement of the discovery.
questions.description: Yet suggests that something which is expected has not happened.

questions.question: I have .............................. finished.
questions.description: Already suggests that something has happened sooner than expected.

questions.question: 'Has the postman been?' 'Not ............................'
questions.description: Yet suggests that something which is expected has not happened.

questions.question: He was angry, ............................ he said nothing.
questions.description: Yet can introduce a contrasting idea.

questions.question: As .............................., I haven't had the time to finish that novel.
questions.description: Yet suggests that something which is expected has not happened.

questions.question: By the time we reached there, they had .............................. left.
questions.description: Already suggests that something has happened sooner than expected.

questions.question: The guests have ............................... arrived.
questions.description: Already suggests that something has happened sooner than expected.

questions.question: Have you called the plumber ..............................?
questions.description: In questions yet is used to ask whether something has happened.

questions.question: The mangoes aren't ripe ....................................
questions.description: Yet suggests that something which is expected has not happened.

questions.question: When I was ten, I ............................ knew that I wanted to be a writer.
questions.description: Already suggests that something has happened sooner than expected.
